description: US Open Tacoma Best Overall Winner Jaden Iwaasa stops by to talk about their army and experiences at the event, walking us through each game.
title: Army Showcase: Jaden Iwaasa Talks About Winning Best Overall with Space Wolves at Tacoma

description: Howdy scummers! As the dust settles on the Hive Secundus release, the Necromunday team wanted to chat about picking a first gang. There are so many to choose from – let’s take a look at the discussion. Is there any high-level advice you have for someone who is choosing their first Necromunda gang? Fowler: The […]
title: Necromunday – Roundtable: Which Gang Should You Start With?

description: Summer 2024 marks the 110th anniversary of the cataclysmic events that led to World War I. Despite being one of the most pivotal events of the 20th century, WWI has not achieved nearly as much representation on the tabletop as its sequel, and we at Goonhammer hope to shine a little light on this fascinating […]
title: Goonhammer Historicals: 1918 Ruleset Author Interview

description: This week’s Hammer of Math looks at the differences between the shooting and melee output of Kharadron Overlord Grundstok Thunderers and Arkanaut Company. Kharadron Overlords in Age of Sigmar have always intrigued me. Professionally I’m an engineer, so anything to do with science and technology is always fun. I’m also 6’9″ and have a beard, […]
title: Hammer of Math: Age of Sigmar Arkanaut Company vs Grundstok Thunderers

description: Well, when a mommy hero and a daddy hero love each other very much… Tacticus has a lot of heroes.  There are 16 factions with 79 heroes between them, counting Machines of War, and every month sees at least one new hero introduced. That’s a lot!  But, just like their plastic counterparts, these heroes don’t […]
title: Where Baby Space Marines Come From: Getting New Characters in Warhammer 40K Tacticus

description: THE BROS ARE BACK with the end of their journey of self-discovery through Necromunda.
title: Battle Bros Season Four, Chapter XI: Not Allowed to Say “Distraction Winkie” Any More
